thread.title: Toyota Hilux 2.4G Limited Edition – dark bits on white
thread.title_full: Toyota Hilux 2.4G Limited Edition – dark bits on white

author: Danny Tan
title: Toyota Hilux 2.4G Limited Edition – dark bits on white
text:
/ 2 comments 
The Toyota Hilux 2.4G Limited Edition has now been officially announced, after surfacing online yesterday . The LE is based on the Hilux 2.4G AT , which sits just below the range-topping 2.8L model in the local Hilux lineup . This limited edition is dressed up in a significantly more rugged outfit. 
The Hilux LE comes in white, which contrasts nicely with the chrome-replacing dark add-ons. Up front, there’s a black grille, dark grey headlamp covers, gloss dark grey fog lamp covers and hood garnish. There’s also a bumper guard to emphasise the off-road look. No more chrome wing mirrors; they’re black here, along with the darkened rims and over fenders. 
Black stripes sit on the truck’s bonnet and the roof gets a large piece of black sticker along with ornamental “roof rails”. Also present are carbon fibre effect stickers for the B pillars, dark grey rear lamp covers and more stripes on the side and tailgate. All the accessories have been tested and pass Toyota’s high quality standards, UMW Toyota Motor says. Click to enlarge 
The interior has been left untouched, and there are no mechanical changes, so one gets the new 2.4 litre GD series engine with 150 PS and 400 Nm of torque, available between 1,600 rpm and 2,000 rpm. The 2GD-FTV turbodiesel is paired to a six-speed automatic transmission and four-wheel drive. 
Priced at RM126,000 on-the-road including insurance, which is RM4,100 costlier than the standard 2.4G AT, the LE comes with keyless entry and push start, a 6.1-inch touchscreen head unit, eight-way powered driver’s seat, leather, three airbags, VSC and window tint, among other things. 
UMWT also took the opportunity to officially announce the 2.4G STD variants that appeared in price lists last month. The STD models have slightly lower specs than the 2.4G, which also mean lower entry prices – RM108,500 for the MT and RM118,300 for the AT.
